item.title: David add a quote by Clare Boothe Luce
item.description: "Money can't buy happiness, but it can make you awfully comfortable while you're being miserable." -- Clare Boothe Luce

item.title: David add a quote by Tom Waits
item.description: "I'd rather have a bottle in front of me than a frontal lobotomy." -- Tom Waits

item.title: David add a quote by Pablo Neruda
item.description: "I love you as certain dark things are to be loved, in secret, between the shadow and the soul." -- Pablo Neruda

item.title: David add a quote by Charles Bukowski
item.description: "Some people never go crazy. What truly horrible lives they must lead." -- Charles Bukowski

item.title: David add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Two things are infinite: the universe and human stupidity; and I'm not sure about the universe." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: David add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "Outside of a dog, a book is man's best friend. Inside of a dog it's too dark to read." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: David add a quote by J.P. Donleavy
item.description: "Writing is turning life's worst moments into money." -- J.P. Donleavy

item.title: David add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "If you can't explain it to a six year old, you don't understand it yourself." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: David add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "I have never let my schooling interfere with my education." -- Mark Twain

item.title: David add a quote by Knut Hamsun
item.description: "I suffered no pain, my hunger had taken the edge off; instead I felt pleasantly empty, untouched by everything around me and happy to be unseen by all. I put my legs up on the bench and leaned back, the best way to feel the true well-being of seclusion. There wasn't a cloud in my mind, nor did I feel any discomfort, and I hadn't a single unfulfilled desire or craving as far as my thought could reach. I lay with open eyes in a state of utter absence from myself and felt deliciously out of it." -- Knut Hamsun

item.title: David add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "We are what we pretend to be, so we must be careful about what we pretend to be." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: David add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "Those who believe in telekinetics, raise my hand." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: David add a quote by Benjamin Franklin
item.description: "Either write something worth reading or do something worth writing." -- Benjamin Franklin

item.title: David add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "And Lot's wife, of course, was told not to look back where all those people and their homes had been. But she did look back, and I love her for that, because it was so human. So she was turned into a pillar of salt. So it goes." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: David add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "Should I kill myself, or have a cup of coffee?" -- Albert Camus

item.title: David add a quote by Leonard Cohen
item.description: "A sip of wine, a cigarette, And then it’s time to go. I tidied up the kitchenette; I tuned the old banjo. I’m wanted at the traffic-jam. They’re saving me a seat." -- Leonard Cohen

item.title: David add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Experience is merely the name men gave to their mistakes." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: David add a quote by Timothy Leary
item.description: "Women who seek to be equal with men lack ambition." -- Timothy Leary

item.title: David add a quote by Veronica Rossi
item.description: "She looked up. “A world of nevers under a never sky.” She fit in well then, he thought. A girl who never shut up." -- Veronica Rossi

item.title: David add a quote by Bertrand Russell
item.description: "There are two motives for reading a book; one, that you enjoy it; the other, that you can boast about it." -- Bertrand Russell

item.title: David add a quote by Cicero. M Tullius
item.description: "Times are bad. Children no longer obey their parents, and everyone is writing a book." -- Cicero. M Tullius

item.title: David add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "Idleness is fatal only to the mediocre." -- Albert Camus

item.title: David add a quote by George Carlin
item.description: "There are nights when the wolves are silent and only the moon howls. " -- George Carlin

item.title: David add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "A thing is not necessarily true because a man dies for it." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: David add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "A good friend will always stab you in the front." -- Oscar Wilde
